results.name: Triangle read by rows: row n (n >= 2) has length pi(n) (see A000720) and the k-th term gives the exponent of prime(k) in the prime factorization of n.
comment: If we suppress the 0's at the ends of the rows we get A067255. The number of 0's suppressed is A036234(n)-A061395(n)-1. - _Jacques ALARDET_, Jan 11 2012
Otherwise said, the number of suppressed (= trailing) 0's in row n is A000720(n)-A061395(n). - _M. F. Hasler_, Mar 10 2013
formula: t(n,m,k)=If[PrimeQ[FactorInteger[n][[m]][[1]]] && FactorInteger[n][[m]][[ 1]] == Prime[k], FactorInteger[n][[m]][[2]], 0]; T(n,m)=vector_sum overk of t(n,m,k).
mathematica: Clear[t, T, n, m, k]; t[n_, m_, k_] := If[PrimeQ[FactorInteger[ n][[m]][[1]]] && FactorInteger[n][[m]][[1]] == Prime[k], FactorInteger[n][[m]][[2]], 0]; T = Table[Apply[Plus, Table[Table[t[n, m, k], {k, 1, PrimePi[n]}], { m, 1, Length[FactorInteger[n]]}]], {n, 1, 10}]; Flatten[%]
